name: cancel_workflow_run
description:
Cancel a workflow run.

his function cancels a workflow run. It uses the `owner` of the repository,
the `repo` name, and the `run_id` to identify the specific workflow run
to be cancelled.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. This is typically the username or organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run to be cancelled.

name: get_workflow
description:
Get details of a specific workflow.

Gets details of a specific workflow.

workflow_id.description:
The identifier of the workflow.
This can be the workflow's integer ID (as a string)
or its filename (e.g., "main.yml" or ".github/workflows/main.yml").

name: get_workflow_run
description:
Get details of a specific workflow run.

This function retrieves detailed information for a specific workflow run.
It takes the repository owner's name, the repository name, and the unique
identifier of the workflow run as input. The function returns a dictionary
containing comprehensive details about the workflow run, including its
status, timing, associated commit, involved actors, and the repository
it belongs to. Datetime fields within the response are ISO 8601 formatted strings
with a 'Z' suffix indicating UTC.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run.

name: get_workflow_run_jobs
description:
Get jobs for a specific workflow run.

Gets jobs for a specific workflow run, identified by owner, repository, and run ID.
The function allows filtering jobs by their status and paginating through the results.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run.

filter.description:
Filters jobs by their status. Valid values: 'latest' (default)
returns the latest job for each job name, 'all' returns all jobs for the run.
Defaults to 'latest'.

page.description: Page number of the results to fetch. Starts at 1. Defaults to 1.

per_page.description: The number of results per page (maximum 100). Defaults to 30.

name: get_workflow_usage
description:
Get usage statistics of a workflow.

This function retrieves the billable usage statistics for a specific workflow,
broken down by operating system.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

workflow_id.description:
The ID of the workflow (as an positive integer) or the workflow's filename
(as a string, e.g., 'ci.yml').

name: list_workflow_runs
description:
List all workflow runs for a repository or a specific workflow.

This function lists workflow runs for a given repository. It supports
filtering by various attributes of the workflow run such as the triggering actor,
branch, event, status, creation date, and associated workflow ID.
It also allows for excluding runs triggered by pull requests and filtering by
a specific check suite ID. Pagination is supported via page and per_page
parameters. Datetime fields in the response are ISO 8601 formatted strings
with a 'Z' suffix indicating UTC.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

workflow_id.description: Filters runs by a specific workflow ID or workflow file name.

actor.description: Filters runs by the login of the actor who initiated them.

branch.description: Filters runs by the branch they ran on.

event.description: Filters runs by the event that triggered them.

status.description:
Filters runs by their current status. Valid values include:
'queued', 'in_progress', 'completed', 'action_required',
'cancelled', 'failure', 'neutral', 'skipped', 'stale',
'success', 'timed_out', 'waiting', 'requested', 'pending'.

created.description:
Filters runs by their creation date or date range.
Supported formats:
- 'YYYY-MM-DD': For runs created on this specific day.
- '>=YYYY-MM-DD': For runs created on or after this date.
- '<=YYYY-MM-DD': For runs created on or before this date.
- 'YYYY-MM-DD..YYYY-MM-DD': For runs created within this inclusive range.

exclude_pull_requests.description: If true, runs triggered by 'pull_request' events are excluded. Defaults to false.

check_suite_id.description: Filters runs by the ID of an associated check suite.

page.description: Page number for pagination, starting at 1. Defaults to 1.

per_page.description: Number of results per page for pagination. Defaults to 30, maximum is 100.

name: list_workflows
description:
List workflows in a GitHub repository.

This function lists workflows in a GitHub repository. It allows for pagination
to retrieve workflows in chunks.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

page.description: Page number of the results to fetch. Defaults to 1.

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100). Defaults to 30.

name: rerun_workflow
description:
Re-run a workflow run.

This API endpoint allows re-running a previously executed workflow run.
It creates a new workflow run attempt based on the original run's configuration.
The new run will start in a 'queued' state.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run to re-run.

name: trigger_workflow
description:
Triggers a workflow dispatch event for a given workflow.

This function simulates the triggering of a workflow, corresponding
to a 'workflow_dispatch' event. It creates a new workflow run record
in the database and returns an acknowledgement.

The actor initiating this workflow is hardcoded because, in this context,
authentication details (and thus the specific user) are not available.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension.

workflow_id.description:
The ID of the workflow or the workflow file name
(e.g., 'main.yaml', 'ci.yml').

ref.description:
The Git reference for the workflow. This can be a branch name
(e.g., 'main'), a tag name (e.g., 'v1.0.0'), or a commit SHA.

inputs.description:
Input parameters to pass to the workflow. These correspond
to the 'inputs' defined in the workflow's 'on.workflow_dispatch'
trigger. If the workflow does not expect inputs, this can be
omitted or an empty dictionary.
